title: Charles Woodson
summary: Charles Cameron Woodson (born October 7, 1976) is an American former professional football player in the National Football League (NFL). He played college football for the Michigan Wolverines, where he led the team to a share of the national championship in 1997. Woodson, a "two-way player" who played both offense and defense, won the Heisman Trophy in the same year.[1] To date, he is the only primarily defensive player to win the Heisman. Woodson went on to accomplish a storied career professionally with one of the most decorated professional football resumes of all time.
